Pre-Game Insights: South Africa turned on the style in front of goal as they ran out emphatic 5-0 winners against Congo in Friday's encounter.
It is now 11 matches since the Bafana Bafana were last beaten, and that recent resurgence has propelled them to second place in their AFCON qualifying group, trailing Uganda only on goal difference.
South Africa picked up the bronze medal from the most recent AFCON tournament in Ivory Coast earlier this year and will be keen to go one better in next year's continental event.
Congo kicked off their qualifying journey with a narrow 1-0 victory over South Sudan on September 5, but things have not gone as planned since then.
Congo suffered a 2-0 defeat to Uganda in their subsequent outing four days later before being on the receiving end of a comprehensive 5-0 thrashing against South Africa last time out.
Interim manager Isaac Ngata has endured a rough spell since taking over from Paul Put on a temporary basis back in 2023, and it is highly unlikely the 59-year-old's appointment is made permanent.
Teboho Mokoena has now scored eight times for South Africaâ€”more than any other active player with the exception of Percy Tau and Themba Zwane.
Iqraam Rayners continues to knock on the door for a first international start since June.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Congo's Christopher Ibayi was handed his full debut for Congo in the defeat to South Africa, but the 29-year-old failed to impress and could drop to the bench here.
Christoffer Mafoumbi recently racked up his 38th cap to move level with fellow goalkeeper Brice Samba into 10th place on the hosts' all-time appearances chart.
Others: The match will take place at Stade Alphonse Massamba-Debat.
The hosts need a win to get their AFCON pursuit back on track before the final set of matches in November, while the visitors set out in search of a win that would confirm their place in Morocco.

We say: Congo 1-3 South Africa. Still buoyed by their commanding victory last time out, South Africa will head into this one on a high, and it is hard to bet against them completing a double over Congo.
